title: Maybe it won't be as we had imagined, because it will be better
text:
My Rules

If you want to marry me, here's what you'll have to do:
You must learn how to make a perfect chicken-dumpling stew.
And you must sew my holey socks,
And soothe my troubled mind,
And develop the knack for scratching my back,
And keep my shoes spotlessly shined.
And while I rest you must rake up the leaves,
And when it is hailing and snowing
You must shovel the walk ... and be still when I talk,
And -- hey -- where are you going?

(Shel Silverstein)

title: by the glare of stars.
text:
My heart is a message in a bottle. Every night I send it out. Sometimes it is 12:51AM, sometimes 2:32AM, other times 4:30AM. I have an intimate relationship with the night, and when I go out beneath those dark skies I am thankful, no matter how tired I am. The sky is alive with worlds and star systems, circling, cycling, and orbiting. Venus slinks around the edges of the horizon like a shy girl at a school dance, as Orion prowls the ink-black depths of the night with his glimmering belt, and his spear ready to throw. 

Owls carry on conversations deep in the forest and I eavesdrop for a few moments. A whippoorwill chants its cool mantra. The breeze, the scent of night, all of it makes me glad that I am not asleep. The average person sleeps one third of her lifespan. She misses all of this, the great gorgeous inflection of the darkness.

The night is for stargazing and lovemaking. It is the peace and quiet which you have earned after another day of life in a machine gun civilization, an escape managed from the clutches of a needy and insecure society. The night is your sanctuary. The night is where you throw your soul into the wind-torn sky and fly it like a dragon-kite. The cold of a winter night makes your bed a hundred times more comfortable than it was. The solitude of the night makes your lovers arms feel more like home. And the starlight you drink makes your blood glisten. 

In the depths of the night is where you find your secret identity. After the socially acceptable façade has dropped and been left behind, hanging by the mailbox in front of your house, and you are long gone. There is a large piece of your true soul which your friends cannot define, cannot understand. There is a wild spirit within you that they wouldn't be able to explain. They, in their daylight clothes and billboard symbolisms of their status, would be frightened of this you. 

This true piece of your soul is an ancient wild thing, only released from its cage by the glare of stars.

title: There Are No Shortcuts In Life
text:
Someone I loved very much used to remind me often that you can't skip steps in life. 
Eventually you'll need to double back and close the gap.

In your career you have to show up and do the work.

In your active pursuits you need to do the work to build endurance and mentally acuity. 

Both is a commitment that takes time and focus.

If you're doing it right and really going after your goals there isn't a lot of time left at the end of the day to meet anyone new.
Leaving your romantic fate up to random conversations in the aisle of Whole Foods feels a little too passive.

Do you want to do the work to build trust and intimacy to get to know a person?

We both know that there is a path to chemistry and a connection that yields relationship benefits well worth the time investment.

Are you ready?

title: Good Help Is Hard To Find: My Search For an FWB
text:
Its been a really long time since I entertained the idea of having an fwb because its been my experience that my partner gets so much more out of it than me. The inequity was obscene.. so I lost absolutely all interest in sex for too long and am only just now remembering that I'm still human. I don't ever want to be that turned off again (it SUCKS) so I will be significantly more careful in choosing a new friend 

My needs are very simple and my gratitude is notable.

What I need is a single, std-free, plus size friendly buddy who can host within Brooklyn/Manhattan (only, no exceptions, sorry). He is ideally a 20-something to mid-30's at best. And. He is awesome. 

Thats it. And I say this with love. I hope you find what you're looking for but if you fall outside of any of these parameters, we do not have anything to talk about.

I don't find a lot of the talk guys do online attractive at all. We all get it. Guys like sex. We do too. But you're going to have to meet me in the middle. That includes leaving the lame **** pics out of my inbox, forever. Don't be pushy or rude. And be a human being. You hate relationships? Don't talk to me about it. An fwb is not a ruse for a boyfriend. We're adults. As far as I'm concerned the criteria for an fwb and bf is very different but as a girl who wants more Boyfriend Experience and less favor-for-randoms, I'm not interested in listening to how everyone under 30 is so dumb for wanting to be with anyone. I want to be doused with lots affection, to give it in return and to play with someone who isn't weighed down by a chip on his shoulder. 

Just interested in having a truly enjoyable time every time I see you. Fun, carefree fun, with someone who can be trusted. Actual friends, actual benefits. 

Here's to hoping you're out there.

title: Curvy and Herpes
text:
I posted this before as "Curvy and Herpes, what more could you want?" but it seemed to invite people to ridicule my situation, so I tries something different in the title. (then it got flagged. If I'm not your thing that's cool, but I'm real and those std sites are not used much ) Same post though as it is still true:

Let's just cut to the chase: Herpes is either a big deal to you, or not. 
So if you have educated yourself, you know that it is difficult to pass (2-4% chance from woman to man) but I just need to you be cool with it or have it yourself. I've had it a couple years but never had an outbreak, so it isn't on my radar until I have to have the "talk" with someone and it is just not something I want to have to keep doing. Getting it out in the open is much easier. Okay, on to things that actually matter to those of you who got this far. . .
I'm 50 years old, divorced with grown children. I am looking for love /connection /LTR, BUT we all know that starts with friendship. Age range.. Probably above 35.. I've dated most races(I'm white) and really it's all about being similar enough to relate and different enough to be interesting. I love my life and I'm looking for a connection. While I have my act together, I find I am always learning and growing and finding new things I want to try or learn about. Not daily, but I'm an open-minded person. I don't smoke, but I am cool with 420. Also, I am a curvy girl, so if you really only like slim, petite or athletic, you probably should move on. 
OK.. your turn. 
If you really need a picture of me right away, send yours. If you just ask me for a picture, I'm going to think you never read to the end of my post and are just a con man (yes, that is what we women run into). Please do tell me a little bit about yourself when you reply.

title: ....gets in the way of a charmed life :(
text:
I walk through the cold today, it's not too bad - I have a great coat. I sit on the train, on the padded bottom of my coat and lay my head on the lovely lining of my hood and look out the window while I listen to my favorite Coldplay/Adele/Keith Sweat/Aretha/whoever song, the trees are brown and bare of their leaves, the ponds still, and I marvel at my charmed life. 

I get to the office and again, marvel because, while it may not seem like the greatest job in the world, it's the greatest job for me right now. I am truly blessed to have it.

Then I go home, there's just me right now (I am blessed with 2 awesome daughters). Then It's a bit of an existence, even a drag - I don't like it but this is the card I have been dealt, for right now and the loneliness sucks. Enough to make me forget that I am truly blessed elsewhere.

Anyone else feel that way or something? Please be age appropriate.

Thank you and good luck in your search!

title: 15 Things That Make You Want to Give Up On Dating
text:
Like most things, there are pros and cons to dating. Sometimes it may seem like a necessary evil on the road to finding love (and it is), but that doesn't mean you don't sometimes want to throw your hands up in the air and say, "forget it! I'd rather be single for life." The planning, the getting your hopes up about a new guy, the being disappointed, the feeling like there are no decent guys left in the world, we've all been there. They do say you'll find the One when you stop looking, so maybe it's time we just put that little piece of dating wisdom to the test.

1. Guys who'd rather text forever than make solid plans. What is he waiting for? Does he need a hand written invitation in order to hang out with you in person? Even worse when you take a chance and ask him out, and he still can't seem to commit to anything.

2. When you find out he already has a girlfriend. But we had such a connection, what do you mean he's not single? Why would he flirt with me like that then?!

3. When your friend meets her soul mate after being on OKCupid for literally 24 hours. How is it that you could scour that site for weeks and barely scrape together a couple dates, and she finds the Chris Pratt in the online dating rough without even having a photo up?!

4. When he invites you out and then "forgets" his wallet. Look, we have no problem paying for our half, but when it's clear he had no intention of paying at all, we have to consider sneaking out through the bathroom window, and leaving him to wash dishes to pay off his debt.

5. When his idea of a date is bringing his entire entourage to meet you at a bar at midnight. A date shouldn't involve him making sure his wing man has a shot with one of your friends.

6. When you think it's going well and he freaks out because you left a spare tampon in his bathroom. Or worse, when he accuses you of leaving it there, but it was actually his roommate's girlfriend.

7. The third time you break up with the same person. Somehow it seemed more productive to revive an old relationship than find someone new. You were wrong. Twice. Dating is just too much work.

8. When you can't seem to get past the first date, ever. Even when it seems like the first date was fantastic, somehow planning the second date becomes harder than trying to schedule brunch with Beyonce.

9. The unsolicited dick pic. Once second you were innocently talking about the third season of House of Cards, and the next, there's a dick on your phone.

10. Watching your friend go through a bad breakup. If you start dating someone, there's a pretty good chance that crying mess on the couch eating an entire bag of Smart Food dipped in peanut butter will be you in the foreseeable future.

11. Coffee dates. Unless you're going on dates at 9am, caffeine is ill advised. No one wants to put any effort into first dates anymore, meaning you end up drinking way more lattes than you should be, and every date becomes pretty dull and repetitive.

12. When he looks nothing like his picture. The question is, do you call him on it, or do you force a polite smile, chug that latte, and get out of there asap?

13. When he leaves you with the bill because you didn't want to hook up. This guy doesn't even pretend he forgot his wallet. He just doesn't come back from the bathroom. So that's why he chose the corner booth with no view of the door.

14. Finding out he's a racist, homophobic, pro-life, misogynistic actual crazy person. It's official, there are no nice, normal guys left. You can end the search now.

15. When staying home in your pjs is more appealing than going out. You could go on another date with this guy, or that guy, but why bother? At least your cat doesn't have uncontrollable gas or make you watch UFC. Once you realize the gloriousness of being single, there isn't much short of a millionaire who looks like David Beckham that will convince you to go on a date ever again. At least for now.

title: The Dating Game
text:
Bachelor number one, "If your date told your best friend that she wanted to be picked up in style for an evening at Carnegie Hall which of these forms of conveyance will you choose to arrive at her door?.
A. A Limousine
B. A horse and carriage
C. Your own car, after you've sprung to have it detailed.

Bachelor number two, "Your date is a divorce attorney. What would you do to give her confidence that your first date may in fact, not be your last?
A. You would bring her a lavish, yet tasteful bouquet of flowers.
B. You would arrive to pick her up from her home ten minutes early with a surprise of tickets to a U2
concert in a city 5 hours away, with round trip plane tickets tucked into the envelope 
C. You would buy yourself a new suit, get your hair cut. You want her to know you take care of yourself and you'll be around for a long, long time.

Bachelor number three. "Your date is a well known politician. What kind of evening would you plan to provide her with a boost in the latest polls?"
A. You would make reservations at the finest French restaurant, followed up by an evening at the opening of a new Broadway show. See and be seen is your motto.
B. You would treat her to an evening at the opening show of the newest up and coming visual artist at an exclusive gallery in mid town.
C. You would rent a Lamborghini and drive her to one of the most trendy clubs in town, and give her a chance to let her hair down and dance the night away.

title: Beeep Beeep!!
text:
I'm seeking a single light haired, light eyes professional man based in Manhattan, aged 36-48 who can pass the traffic test (see below). Foodie, not Hipster. No facial hair. J. Crew, not Goth. Valid passport.

I am a dark haired, dark eyes female executive based in Manhattan. Long, straight hair. Glasses. Traveled. Articulate. Funny. Loves cooking, photography & reading. Not a karaoke fan. Nor sake. Nor soju. Love me a Frappacino with lots of whipped cream, though. Let's discuss over dinner. I love seafood & red meat. Whiskey > wine. 

The Traffic Test, exerpted from a larger piece by Tim Urban.

> I enjoy spending time with most of my friends--that's why they're my
> friends. But with certain friends, the time is so high-quality, so
> interesting, and so fun that they pass the Traffic Test.
>
> The Traffic Test is passed when I'm finishing up a hangout with
> someone and one of us is driving the other back home or back to their
> car, and I find myself rooting for traffic. That's how much I'm
> enjoying the time with them.
>
> Passing the Traffic Test says a lot. It means I'm lost in the
> interaction, invigorated by it, and that I'm the complete opposite of
> bored.
>
> To me, almost nothing is more critical in choosing a life partner than
> finding someone who passes the Traffic Test. When there are people in
> your life who do pass the Traffic Test, what a whopping shame it would
> be to spend 95% of the rest of your life with someone who doesn't.
>
> A Traffic Test-passing friendship entails:
>
> A great sense of humor click. No one wants to spend 50 years fake laughing.
> Fun. And the ability to extract fun out of unfun situations--airport
> delays, long drives, errands. Not surprisingly, studies suggest that
> the amount of fun a couple has is a strong predictor for their
> future.6
> A respect for each other's brains and way of thinking. A life partner
> doubles as a career/life therapist, and if you don't respect the way
> someone thinks, you're not going to want to tell them your thoughts on
> work each day, or on anything else interesting that pops into your
> head, because you won't really care that much what they have to say
> about it.
> A decent number of common interests, activities, and
> people-preferences. Otherwise a lot of what makes you 'you' will
> inevitably become a much smaller part of your life, and you and your
> life partner will struggle to find enjoyable ways to spend a free
> Saturday together.
>
> A friendship that passes the Traffic Test gets better and better with
> time, and it has endless room to deepen and grow ever-richer.

title: securely tucked
text:
1) Don't send me dick pics.
2) I'm a 31 year old single mother of 3. Yes, 3. If that doesn't float your boat, fine, but please don't message me.
3) I'm not on here looking to get laid.
4) If anyone is possibly romantically interested, I'd prefer to date within the realm of my age group.
5) If you're not led to tell me some of your desires or creatively express an emotional side to me, I'm probably not interested. "Hey how are you?" can only go so far...

Home.

I want it to feel like home.

That scent. Familiar. Normal.

You know. . .that weird, flowery, musty, all encompassing smell. The kind of smell that instantly takes you back, all the way back. It's that 'not' so random memory, securely tucked, snug into the depths of your intimate heart space.

That scent is you.

On your knees, deep in the closet of your childhood home. Reaching passed your mother's dress-up, church coat and your daddy's clay dusted, work boots. You reach juuust passed your brother's most treasured toy train, laying haphazardly in all its played with glory, to find your most favorite pair of sneakers, hidden deep inside the closet's bosom. Those well cared for shoes that you've worn long enough to perfectly mold to your graceful, yet still semi-clumsy feet. As you breathe in, you catch just a hint of the peppermint gum hidden within the pocket of your mama's wool coat. Your shoes were kept safe from your sister's greedy hands for just one more day!

Home.

I want to be floored with memories that last a lifetime when I inhale~You.

I picture me greeting your gently whiskered cheek with my partially parched lips in a comfort filled, hurried embrace. You hear the shuffle of little feet, giggles, and exasperated warnings not to be late. We're off to their next biggest adventure! We share in one heavenly glazed, long paused expression. With heavy lids, our moment's embrace ends, but not without the silent promise of our own nighttime adventures to come.

Home

title: Yeah,... I have my doubts about love...and yet I miss it
text:
My plans to go dancing with friends went to hell... so I'm home eating chips and drinking a cocktail I made. Kinda bored. I'm used to being super busy. I work 56-64 hours a week usually. In my time off I'm out with girl friends exploring NYC. I 
Haven't been in a relationship since last May. I figured I need time to heal and do some self-improvement. Used the typical dating apps, but nothing was good since I was not interested in dating...
In the meantime, I've been meditating, exercising, I went to the rainforest and had Ayahuasca ceremonies, I read and always looking for new experiences to expand consciousness. I think I'm ready now! Somedays I do miss love. Whatever it means ha. I love my life, but I'm tired of waiting for that someone who is compatible with me and will connect. It's the hardest thing, don't you agree? If I connect with someone intellectually, I'm not attracted to them... and viceversa. It's frustrating!
I'm looking for a male 32-42...white, black or brown hair preferably. I know what I like ;)
a good heart, compassionate soul, with strong will and humility. Someone who is not a total extrovert. I'm an social introvert... men who need constant attention tire me. Educated, Hard working, with manners, no ex issues, no vices, no craziness, no evil. Can speak and read well! proper grammar turns me on haha.
Is love real anyway? sometimes I feel it's just a trap for humans to reproduce. It's all hormones, right?
I'm asian looking. I'm educated. Well traveled. In shape, love to run and work out. Love dogs. ugh... what the hell is this!? haha... I feel cheap now! anyway... Happy Saturday! cheers :D

title: "As You Wish"
text:
Great girl. Cute and fun. With a messy place.
I have hsv. It doesn't effect my life, more of an after thought. My exboyfriend wasn't forthcoming about his condition, since then, I have always been upfront about having herpes. I take suppressants and rarely get outbreaks. Consider the place clean. 

I have had some success on this site before. I am not sure what I am looking for. It's a little like describing a place I haven't been before. I have an idea, but I am flexible. Geography (Manhattan) is somewhat important since I work- time and am in classes in the evenings. I like sciency types- that are a little rugged. Maybe a history lesson will help narrow the field. A few reasons my past dates didn't go all that well:

One guy, I call Kids in the Linen Closet, hid a second bedroom in his apartment (for months). It was a next door to bathroom. So I thought it was a linen closet. It turns out it was a bedroom for two girls. He would deflate a bouncy house ( that was in the living room) every time I would come over. 

One guy lied about his age. He said he was 28 when he was 22. I call him Benjamin Button. Most people take a few years off. He added years, to seem more mature. His cover was blown when he made me dinner. Pasta with prego. While his roommates watched tv.

One guy, a investment banker, within 20 minutes of knowing me was holding my hands and telling me we had a deep connection. This may seem desperate. when he did it...it was smooth. He was a clear player. I haven't given him a name yet.

One guy had a minor melt down (like a toddler) because he couldn't get a taxi. I call him Toddler.

Those are just some of the highlights. 😉...people are always asking why I am single and why I don't have kids....kids turn into those people listed above. 😳. Frightening. 

Bottom line is I would prefer honesty. I am honest about my intentions, I really don't do casual well. Some girls can handle that, I am not really capable. I find them shallow. I want potential for a long term relationship. Though I'll never want the white picket fence in suburbia. Maybe I want the settling down, without really settling down. I like adventure. Weekend trips, new sport, new personal growth pursuit. Etc. 

I am quirky. I stay up late binge watching TWD or something similar. I am agnostic teetering on atheism. Socially very liberal. I have an SUV and am bummed I didn't think of towing skiers down Broadway during the snow storm. Next time! I live in Manhattan. .

I try to get away a few times a year to scuba dive. I enjoy skiing too. Really anything outdoors and physical. Kayaking and riding horses in the summer is also fun.

I love animals- well most animals. Not a fan of snakes or rats. But the rest are cool. 

I am a little tomboy and a little girly. I will rock a cocktail dress and red lipstick. I grew up chasing my neighbors cows on horseback. I am always bruised. I don't even know where they come from.

my father is southern and that side of the family instilled in me an appreciation for chivalry. He opens doors and send me flowers. 

I am looking for a needle in a haystack. I don't really have a type. I prefer someone who works out and is active. I also prefer educated. Witty. Fun. Working or in college, either way you have goals.
Emotionally available. No drugs or smoking. Age appropriate 26-45. Mature 26/ young looking and acting 45. Adventurous is a must. Willingness to try new things. Most like animals. Genuine.


Me:
I am right in the middle 30s. Work out. Nordic. Blonde hair. Bluish grey eyes. Height /weight proportionate. 5'6" 125 lbs. pretty. But it really doesn't define me. I believe in being strong and kind and generous.

I am not perfect, and I don't try to be. Ill never be great a dancing- two left feet for instance. I am very much my own person, but once in a relationship I believe in doing it right.

I work and take classes, I really don't have much time for dating hence the online attempt. 

Please respond with something about yourself and a photo.

Bonus points if you know what movie I referenced in the title

Best of luck!!!

title: Manly man needed for advice or feedback
text:
Hi Everyone, I'm new around here. NYC Mini Clubman Owner here A little history: I bought my car in 2014- 1 owner, at 33k miles I had it inspected in NJ at Prestige before purchase and they said it was very well taken care of- no issues. Dec 2015- My car starts over heating, the signal pops up with a warning to slow down. I pull over and open the hood and its smoking....and a rat jumps out ! I thought, maybe the rat chewed something and caused the problem. Luckily I was around the corner from the mini dealership in NYC. I told them what happened and they said they had to perform an inspection to figure it out. Said it could take awhile so I Left my car from about 11am - 6pm. I received a call with a list of issues. 2 Major Issues: Water Pump Leaking & Found Engine Oil- recommendation was to replace the valve cover gasket. I replaced the water pump at doing that visit in December at 51,098 miles, replaced the valve cover at 52,915 miles, 30 days later due to finances. When I got my car back after the valve cover replacement, I noticed it was not picking up as fast when pressing on the gas. Thought it was just me and then I noticed my gas was running out faster than normal. I drive about 5-10 miles a day unless I'm going to visit family out of state. On top of that, when I pressed the brake at a light it would say, oil pressure low. But it would go away once I continue to drive. I had my oil changed a few weeks prior. I started to hear a cranking noise so I stopped at a auto mechanic in the area. He check under the hood and it was smoking and I had no oil. He filled it up for me and said something wrong or either the person that fixed my car took the oil out and didn't replace it, or maybe they did not check at all. I'm devastated and go online to research and I read about engine problems. I call the dealer and told them what I was experiencing and they gave me an appointment to come in 2 weeks later. I got the call today that I need a new engine. its about 10k I'm trying to figure out, did the dealer do something wrong or.... after thinking about it. A car backed into my car while it was parked. The driver thought he was in drive mode and reversed out of a parking spot in front of me with force. I was there when it happened. Everyone freaked out and though someone got hurt because it was very loud. But there was not damage I could not see well because it was at night. I did file a report because there was paint damage. On my report from the dealer, it mentions that the hood needed excessive force to open. Which is odd because I could open my hood with ease. I know my story is long, but any advice would be appreciated. I love my Mini...I don't want the fun to be over. My question is: When you get a service like a Found Engine Oil- recommendation was to replace the valve cover gasket. Do they not check the oil before, after? From the report they test drove my car about 4 miles. The dealer claim they should have checked but it wasn't necessary for the work they were performing. This negligence may have resulted in the damages to my engine....or is it possible when the car backed into me something cracked and led to a oil leak. My assumption is from my first inspection, the only issue was a cracked valve cover and I just needed to replace it. Nothing was mentioned about my engine. btw, I get regular oil changes at a local place, not the dealer and have all my records. I've never had to put extra oil in my car and never had anyone tell me my car burned or leaked oil.

just looking for advice or feedback.

title: Are you spiritually and morally sound
text:
I do realize this is a long shot ! I'm a Christian woman (not boring or a bible freak). I have noticed that you stop being "cool" once you give your life to Christ, and have unpopular/ mainstream ideologies about life, especially living in a big city like NYC.

I'm compelled and up for the challenge of meeting someone, not necessarily uber "religious", but definitely spiritual, with awareness of a higher/ supreme being. Essentially, I am in search of a person with whom I can share a deep spiritual connection with and everything else will follow. 

Before you go throwing stones, I am well aware of the fact that I am posting on Craig's list. You see, Jesus in his days on earth didn't only hangout with the "righteous", he hung out with Everyone. No one is perfect, as long as they sought first the kingdom of God!

Quick Stats: I Just turned 36 (look younger), Single, never married and no children, but hope to have some in the future. I stand about 5"4 ,128 lb brown eyes, short black hair, and considered attractive. As you may have gathered, I'm NOT looking for a quick fling or immoral ventures. 

Not much into club scenes, but I drink wine lightly. I go to places where we can actually hear each other. I like live Broadway shows, Church activities, I enjoy theaters, volunteering, restaurants, shopping, museums, sports, festivals, trade shows, traveling etc. 

I live in Brooklyn but i'm in the City quite often. I work very hard and anyone who knows me will tell you that although far from perfect, I am a strong and driven woman. I hope to one day, in conjunction with my future partner, build a fulfilling life. 

See, a lot of people are very lonely, and afraid to admit it, even to themselves. They try to fill this void by turning to the wrong people, heavy drugs, sex, porn, food addiction, all to "escape" reality, no matter how temporary. They ignore the fact that these are only temporary fixes which has time progresses, only makes matters worse.

I am glad to confirm that I am neither lonely nor do I need someone to "make me happy" or "complete me", that's what my relationship with God is for. It took a while, and by no means am I here to judge anyone. I have learnt that no one could ever make me happy unless I really got to know myself, reflect and rewind in order to find true internal happiness. 

This process invariably starts with relationship with a supreme being, continuous gratitude, positivity, love and empathy for all mankind. Not even accumulation of material things could come close to. accomplishing this task.

I know I have written quite alot, especially for a "personal ad" on Craig's List and due to the non conventional nature of this content, I do not expect an overflow/ influx of meritless responses, and that's perfectly fine by me. 

If you have read this far, chances are that you may have been touched, regardless of how slight and therefore it has provoked a thought. 

Please, ONLY respond if you somewhat agree with the above, if you are a single or divorced Male aged 30-45, attractive (pictures a MUST), you are driven, looking to strengthen your spirituality, and are looking for something substantial in a potential partner.

title: NYC's Exclusive Club for Love
text:
Are you tired that

 speed dating only leads you to speed disappointment? 
 tinder swipes turn you into vulnerable objects at the disposal of some stranger's fingertip? 
 the half-hearted "hey sup?" or "wanna grab a drink?" was not even specially crafted for you? 


The Exclusive Club for Love is coming to New York City, the loneliest city on earth, to rescue you. How are we different? 

 we screen our members and are exclusive to those who are sincerely looking for someone specially for them. If you are one, you will only meet people with the same mindset. 
 and yes, if you are looking for hookups only, you are not welcome. 
 you get specially selected matches just for you, you get to know them as real people and you know they are not browsing other options but devoting their time to you. 
 we provide you as much guidance as you need in your dating life. 

As a bonus, if you end up getting married with someone you meet through us, we even have a special wedding gift for you!

title: Beeep Beeep!!
text:
I'm seeking a single light haired, light eyes professional man based in Manhattan, aged 36-48 who can pass the traffic test (see below). Foodie, not Hipster. No facial hair. J. Crew, not Goth. Valid passport.

I am a dark haired, dark eyes female executive based in Manhattan. Long, straight hair. Glasses. Traveled. Articulate. Funny. Loves cooking, photography & reading. Not a karaoke fan. Nor sake. Nor soju. Love me a Frappacino with lots of whipped cream, though. Let's discuss over dinner. I love seafood & red meat. Whiskey > wine. 

The Traffic Test, exerpted from a larger piece by Tim Urban.

> I enjoy spending time with most of my friends--that's why they're my
> friends. But with certain friends, the time is so high-quality, so
> interesting, and so fun that they pass the Traffic Test.
>
> The Traffic Test is passed when I'm finishing up a hangout with
> someone and one of us is driving the other back home or back to their
> car, and I find myself rooting for traffic. That's how much I'm
> enjoying the time with them.
>
> Passing the Traffic Test says a lot. It means I'm lost in the
> interaction, invigorated by it, and that I'm the complete opposite of
> bored.
>
> To me, almost nothing is more critical in choosing a life partner than
> finding someone who passes the Traffic Test. When there are people in
> your life who do pass the Traffic Test, what a whopping shame it would
> be to spend 95% of the rest of your life with someone who doesn't.
>
> A Traffic Test-passing friendship entails:
>
> A great sense of humor click. No one wants to spend 50 years fake laughing.
> Fun. And the ability to extract fun out of unfun situations--airport
> delays, long drives, errands. Not surprisingly, studies suggest that
> the amount of fun a couple has is a strong predictor for their
> future.6
> A respect for each other's brains and way of thinking. A life partner
> doubles as a career/life therapist, and if you don't respect the way
> someone thinks, you're not going to want to tell them your thoughts on
> work each day, or on anything else interesting that pops into your
> head, because you won't really care that much what they have to say
> about it.
> A decent number of common interests, activities, and
> people-preferences. Otherwise a lot of what makes you 'you' will
> inevitably become a much smaller part of your life, and you and your
> life partner will struggle to find enjoyable ways to spend a free
> Saturday together.
>
> A friendship that passes the Traffic Test gets better and better with
> time, and it has endless room to deepen and grow ever-richer.

title: securely tucked
text:
1) Don't send me dick pics.
2) I'm a 31 year old single mother of 3. Yes, 3. If that doesn't float your boat, fine, but please don't message me.
3) I'm not on here looking to get laid.
4) If anyone is possibly romantically interested, I'd prefer to date within the realm of my age group.
5) If you're not led to tell me some of your desires or creatively express an emotional side to me, I'm probably not interested. "Hey how are you?" can only go so far...

Home.

I want it to feel like home.

That scent. Familiar. Normal.

You know. . .that weird, flowery, musty, all encompassing smell. The kind of smell that instantly takes you back, all the way back. It's that 'not' so random memory, securely tucked, snug into the depths of your intimate heart space.

That scent is you.

On your knees, deep in the closet of your childhood home. Reaching passed your mother's dress-up, church coat and your daddy's clay dusted, work boots. You reach juuust passed your brother's most treasured toy train, laying haphazardly in all its played with glory, to find your most favorite pair of sneakers, hidden deep inside the closet's bosom. Those well cared for shoes that you've worn long enough to perfectly mold to your graceful, yet still semi-clumsy feet. As you breathe in, you catch just a hint of the peppermint gum hidden within the pocket of your mama's wool coat. Your shoes were kept safe from your sister's greedy hands for just one more day!

Home.

I want to be floored with memories that last a lifetime when I inhale~You.

I picture me greeting your gently whiskered cheek with my partially parched lips in a comfort filled, hurried embrace. You hear the shuffle of little feet, giggles, and exasperated warnings not to be late. We're off to their next biggest adventure! We share in one heavenly glazed, long paused expression. With heavy lids, our moment's embrace ends, but not without the silent promise of our own nighttime adventures to come.

Home

title: Yeah,... I have my doubts about love...and yet I miss it
text:
My plans to go dancing with friends went to hell... so I'm home eating chips and drinking a cocktail I made. Kinda bored. I'm used to being super busy. I work 56-64 hours a week usually. In my time off I'm out with girl friends exploring NYC. I 
Haven't been in a relationship since last May. I figured I need time to heal and do some self-improvement. Used the typical dating apps, but nothing was good since I was not interested in dating...
In the meantime, I've been meditating, exercising, I went to the rainforest and had Ayahuasca ceremonies, I read and always looking for new experiences to expand consciousness. I think I'm ready now! Somedays I do miss love. Whatever it means ha. I love my life, but I'm tired of waiting for that someone who is compatible with me and will connect. It's the hardest thing, don't you agree? If I connect with someone intellectually, I'm not attracted to them... and viceversa. It's frustrating!
I'm looking for a male 32-42...white, black or brown hair preferably. I know what I like ;)
a good heart, compassionate soul, with strong will and humility. Someone who is not a total extrovert. I'm an social introvert... men who need constant attention tire me. Educated, Hard working, with manners, no ex issues, no vices, no craziness, no evil. Can speak and read well! proper grammar turns me on haha.
Is love real anyway? sometimes I feel it's just a trap for humans to reproduce. It's all hormones, right?
I'm asian looking. I'm educated. Well traveled. In shape, love to run and work out. Love dogs. ugh... what the hell is this!? haha... I feel cheap now! anyway... Happy Saturday! cheers :D

title: "As You Wish"
text:
Great girl. Cute and fun. With a messy place.
I have hsv. It doesn't effect my life, more of an after thought. My exboyfriend wasn't forthcoming about his condition, since then, I have always been upfront about having herpes. I take suppressants and rarely get outbreaks. Consider the place clean. 

I have had some success on this site before. I am not sure what I am looking for. It's a little like describing a place I haven't been before. I have an idea, but I am flexible. Geography (Manhattan) is somewhat important since I work- time and am in classes in the evenings. I like sciency types- that are a little rugged. Maybe a history lesson will help narrow the field. A few reasons my past dates didn't go all that well:

One guy, I call Kids in the Linen Closet, hid a second bedroom in his apartment (for months). It was a next door to bathroom. So I thought it was a linen closet. It turns out it was a bedroom for two girls. He would deflate a bouncy house ( that was in the living room) every time I would come over. 

One guy lied about his age. He said he was 28 when he was 22. I call him Benjamin Button. Most people take a few years off. He added years, to seem more mature. His cover was blown when he made me dinner. Pasta with prego. While his roommates watched tv.

One guy, a investment banker, within 20 minutes of knowing me was holding my hands and telling me we had a deep connection. This may seem desperate. when he did it...it was smooth. He was a clear player. I haven't given him a name yet.

Before you go throwing stones, I am well aware of the fact that I am posting on Craig's list. You see, Jesus in his days on earth didn't only hangout with the "righteous", he hung out with Everyone. No one is perfect, as long as they sought first the kingdom of God!

title: NYC's Exclusive Club for Love
text:
Are you tired that

 speed dating only leads you to speed disappointment? 
 tinder swipes turn you into vulnerable objects at the disposal of some stranger's fingertip? 
 the half-hearted "hey sup?" or "wanna grab a drink?" was not even specially crafted for you? 


The Exclusive Club for Love is coming to New York City, the loneliest city on earth, to rescue you. How are we different? 

 we screen our members and are exclusive to those who are sincerely looking for someone specially for them. If you are one, you will only meet people with the same mindset. 
 and yes, if you are looking for hookups only, you are not welcome. 
 you get specially selected matches just for you, you get to know them as real people and you know they are not browsing other options but devoting their time to you. 
 we provide you as much guidance as you need in your dating life. 

As a bonus, if you end up getting married with someone you meet through us, we even have a special wedding gift for you!


If you are ready for true love, it's simple to join us: 

Send us an email with subject line "NYC For Love - [Your first name] [Your last name (optional)] [Your gender]". Share with us any dating stories or insights you have in the email. We will keep all information confidential and send you steps to join the club soon.

title: Beeep Beeep!!
text:
I'm seeking a single light haired, light eyes professional man based in Manhattan, aged 36-48 who can pass the traffic test (see below). Foodie, not Hipster. No facial hair. J. Crew, not Goth. Valid passport.

I am a dark haired, dark eyes female executive based in Manhattan. Long, straight hair. Glasses. Traveled. Articulate. Funny. Loves cooking, photography & reading. Not a karaoke fan. Nor sake. Nor soju. Love me a Frappacino with lots of whipped cream, though. Let's discuss over dinner. I love seafood & red meat. Whiskey > wine. 

The Traffic Test, exerpted from a larger piece by Tim Urban.

> I enjoy spending time with most of my friends--that's why they're my
> friends. But with certain friends, the time is so high-quality, so
> interesting, and so fun that they pass the Traffic Test.
>
> The Traffic Test is passed when I'm finishing up a hangout with
> someone and one of us is driving the other back home or back to their
> car, and I find myself rooting for traffic. That's how much I'm
> enjoying the time with them.
>
> Passing the Traffic Test says a lot. It means I'm lost in the
> interaction, invigorated by it, and that I'm the complete opposite of
> bored.
>
> To me, almost nothing is more critical in choosing a life partner than
> finding someone who passes the Traffic Test. When there are people in
> your life who do pass the Traffic Test, what a whopping shame it would
> be to spend 95% of the rest of your life with someone who doesn't.
>
> A Traffic Test-passing friendship entails:
>
> A great sense of humor click. No one wants to spend 50 years fake laughing.
> Fun. And the ability to extract fun out of unfun situations--airport
> delays, long drives, errands. Not surprisingly, studies suggest that
> the amount of fun a couple has is a strong predictor for their
> future.6
> A respect for each other's brains and way of thinking. A life partner
> doubles as a career/life therapist, and if you don't respect the way
> someone thinks, you're not going to want to tell them your thoughts on
> work each day, or on anything else interesting that pops into your
> head, because you won't really care that much what they have to say
> about it.
> A decent number of common interests, activities, and
> people-preferences. Otherwise a lot of what makes you 'you' will
> inevitably become a much smaller part of your life, and you and your
> life partner will struggle to find enjoyable ways to spend a free
> Saturday together.
>
> A friendship that passes the Traffic Test gets better and better with
> time, and it has endless room to deepen and grow ever-richer.

title: securely tucked
text:
1) Don't send me dick pics.
2) I'm a 31 year old single mother of 3. Yes, 3. If that doesn't float your boat, fine, but please don't message me.
3) I'm not on here looking to get laid.
4) If anyone is possibly romantically interested, I'd prefer to date within the realm of my age group.
5) If you're not led to tell me some of your desires or creatively express an emotional side to me, I'm probably not interested. "Hey how are you?" can only go so far...

Home.

I want it to feel like home.

That scent. Familiar. Normal.

You know. . .that weird, flowery, musty, all encompassing smell. The kind of smell that instantly takes you back, all the way back. It's that 'not' so random memory, securely tucked, snug into the depths of your intimate heart space.

That scent is you.

On your knees, deep in the closet of your childhood home. Reaching passed your mother's dress-up, church coat and your daddy's clay dusted, work boots. You reach juuust passed your brother's most treasured toy train, laying haphazardly in all its played with glory, to find your most favorite pair of sneakers, hidden deep inside the closet's bosom. Those well cared for shoes that you've worn long enough to perfectly mold to your graceful, yet still semi-clumsy feet. As you breathe in, you catch just a hint of the peppermint gum hidden within the pocket of your mama's wool coat. Your shoes were kept safe from your sister's greedy hands for just one more day!

Home.

I want to be floored with memories that last a lifetime when I inhale~You.

I picture me greeting your gently whiskered cheek with my partially parched lips in a comfort filled, hurried embrace. You hear the shuffle of little feet, giggles, and exasperated warnings not to be late. We're off to their next biggest adventure! We share in one heavenly glazed, long paused expression. With heavy lids, our moment's embrace ends, but not without the silent promise of our own nighttime adventures to come.

Home

Haven't been in a relationship since last May. I figured I need time to heal and do some self-improvement. Used the typical dating apps, but nothing was good since I was not interested in dating...
In the meantime, I've been meditating, exercising, I went to the rainforest and had Ayahuasca ceremonies, I read and always looking for new experiences to expand consciousness. I think I'm ready now! Somedays I do miss love. Whatever it means ha. I love my life, but I'm tired of waiting for that someone who is compatible with me and will connect. It's the hardest thing, don't you agree? If I connect with someone intellectually, I'm not attracted to them... and viceversa. It's frustrating!
I'm looking for a male 32-42...white, black or brown hair preferably. I know what I like ;)
a good heart, compassionate soul, with strong will and humility. Someone who is not a total extrovert. I'm an social introvert... men who need constant attention tire me. Educated, Hard working, with manners, no ex issues, no vices, no craziness, no evil. Can speak and read well! proper grammar turns me on haha.
Is love real anyway? sometimes I feel it's just a trap for humans to reproduce. It's all hormones, right?
